title: Why is autofill a thing srsly?
body: Like srsly why is it a thing below anything like masters? to shorten game times not really you save maybe 30 seconds at best at my elo P1 queue times are 3 mins not even long so why do we have auto fill enabled ? all it does is save maybe like a minute max since alot of people just dodge which wastes time anyways so its not like auto fill is saving time in that respect since that person now has to wait 5 mins to requeue so he didnt get any time saved form auto fill the the other people also have to wait in queue again so they haven't been saved any time by auto fill and if the game goes through then all that happens is one teams experience is severely hindered since now they have one person who is not as skilled at that role playing against someone who is much more experienced at said role and can impact it to a degree you cant so it literally does nothing for nobody just wastes time and game quality but considering riot games has no idea what they are doing I guess it makes sense auto fill is a thing all they know how to do lately is be greedier really sad how far riot has gone to keep their greed going while not fixing blatant issues with the game .

replies.body:
How are you confident about how much time is saved?

I remember sometimes waiting in Teambuilder for 30+ minutes for roles like top or mid.

I've never waited anywhere near that much time and im high plat even when it wasnt a thing lol besides heres a question wait 30 mins for a quality game or wait 3 then get in a 15-20 minutes long game for a stomp cuz your jungler is autofilled while enemy jungle knows what hes doing and stomps every lane

> [{quoted}](name=Coyote Rose,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mhi2Kw4E,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-07-20T20:13:45.102+0000)
>
> I've never waited anywhere near that much time and im high plat even when it wasnt a thing lol besides heres a question wait 30 mins for a quality game or wait 3 then get in a 15-20 minutes long game for a stomp cuz your jungler is autofilled while enemy jungle knows what hes doing and stomps every lane

I see a lot of people claim that they'd be willing to wait another 30 min for a non-autofilled match, but I doubt that's actually the case. Games can be complete steamrolls with everyone getting their preferred roll so I doubt you're going to notice that much.

Would you prefer to wait for 30 min only to get a "support" that only queued as one so they could get an instant queue?

Teambuilder was highly flawed and underused.

Remember how things worked in draft before autofill? It really did nothing to fix queue times.

> Remember how things worked in draft before autofill?

Yeah. There were NO assigned roles. It was pick order and the people at the bottom pretty much always had to fill.

You ***need*** autofill if you want role selection. It's literally not an option. As long as people queue up more or less for different roles it's literally not an option
Look at current stats, they are all pretty balanced now.
What stats? Last time we got hard stats was from Meddler months ago where mid was the most queued for and support the least across all ELOs. Even a variation of a couple percent requires autofill.

They're balanced because autofill forced people to learn support. Once you take away autofill, people stop queuing for support and remembering how to do it.

Taking away autofill will just revert us to back where we were before.

False. The same pattern exists in MMRs where autofill is nonexistent.

Greatly improving QoL for supports is what makes people play support.
Autofill exists at all MMRs, though?

On populated servers it is rare to nonexistent below plat or diamond.

I have never been autofilled, never known anyone who was, outside high-rank players, and never gotten a definitely autofilled player (the 3-4 who said they are either trolled from select, or made it obvious they just said that as insurance while trying a new role or some weird offmeta stuff).

Maybe one out of a few thousand games will result in an autofill in lower games, unless it is at 3AM or something weird. I suspect the system is completely turned off when not needed.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mhi2Kw4E,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-07-20T20:09:17.772+0000)
>
> How are you confident about how much time is saved?
> 
> I remember sometimes waiting in Teambuilder for 30+ minutes for roles like top or mid.

Because in TB you were only going for 1 role on 1 champ, and people can reject you based on the champ. It also wasn't ranked, where a lot more players queue.

> [{quoted}](name=General Esdeath ,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mhi2Kw4E,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2019-07-20T23:37:10.492+0000)
>
> Because in TB you were only going for 1 role on 1 champ, and people can reject you based on the champ. It also wasn't ranked, where a lot more players queue.

Increasing the number of players doesn't do anything for the ratio of preferred roles. Support is always the role that is in the minority. So much that most people avoid having support even as their secondary because it's pretty much guaranteed that you'll get support if it's your secondary choice.

So it amounts to the same problem.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mhi2Kw4E,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2019-07-20T23:44:53.486+0000)
>
> Increasing the number of players doesn't do anything for the ratio of preferred roles. Support is always the role that is in the minority. So much that most people avoid having support even as their secondary because it's pretty much guaranteed that you'll get support if it's your secondary choice.
> 
> So it amounts to the same problem.

The ratio isn't the problem here. There's more players and the game matches you, there's nobody to say "OH fuck that I don't want AeroWaffle playing Nami jg in my game". If there were more playing in TB it would slightly help but TB let's them see you. If you queue with me I have no clue what you're gonna play. I've put support as my secondary and gotten my primary a healthy amount of times. Once you get to certain elos, it's really not that low in demand compared to lower elos.
Autofill is not that common, most people pretend the 2nd role they queued is autofill.

It's like every week someone asks this question again.

You need autofill, no, without autofill you wont just wait an extra minute, you'll inflate wait times by a lot more.

Support player shortage will create a bottleneck that will increase wait times as more and more players wait for supports to fill their lobby, it happened in team builder, it will happen here.

And lets not pretend people dont feed their ass off on their main role anyway, having no autofill wont gurantee you the best players on your team, you'll still get people using champs they have no idea how to use, people fucking around on their main, people just being bad.
My worst feeders are ALWAYS those one trick mains who think they are some hot shots and always go in no matter what and flame their team.
Meanwhile my autofill supports plays safe and cautionely because he doesnt have the confidence to try to make plays.

Autofill is not optimal, but it's the best solution for both quick wait times and reasonable games.

> to shorten game times not really you save maybe 30 seconds at best

No. This is not how it works. You need autofill with role selection because the least queued role will back queues up more and more and more to the point where the only limiting factor is people dropping out of queue

Because Riot thinks people will quit if they wait too long. And long queue times don't really happen until high plat/low diamond. As a system, it's also pretty flawed. Had too many games where I get autofilled and the person who got my role was autofilled and we swap.
